#Text=Sandeep Kulkarni
#Text=Sandeep Kulkarni ( born 16 November ) is an Indian actor and painter . [ 1 ]
#Text=He has worked in Marathi films as well as theatre .
#Text=Early life and background
#Text=Born in Pune , Sandeep was raised in a Maharashtrian middle-class family by father Shrikant Kulkarni and mother Lata Kulkarni .
#Text=He is an alumnus of J. J. School of Arts , Mumbai . [ 2 ]
#Text=During his journey of becoming an artist at Sir J. J. School of Art , he was mentored by Prabhakar Kolte and Atul Dodia .
#Text=In 1986 , Kulkarni participated in a group monsoon show — the first exhibition of his work at the Jehangir Art Gallery .
#Text=In the same year , he completed his graduation ( Bachelor of Fine Arts ) .
#Text=While pursuing painting , Sandeep was also exploring acting until he met Pandit Satyadev Dubey .
#Text=Heavily influenced and inspired by his teachings , Sandeep found himself perfectly fit to be an actor .
#Text=Career
#Text=After intense theatre for four years in English , Marathi and Hindi , his career started to take shape in television .

#Text=He played varied roles such as that of young Muslim lawyer Salim in love with a local Muslim woman on 9 Malabar Hill on Zee TV , a press reporter in Farz on DD Metro , an underworld don who deals with drugs in Swabhiman on DD , a counselor in Nyay on DD Metro .

#Text=He also played the role of a cop who solves the mystery behind an old couple refusing to accept the dead body of their son in the much-talked-about one-hour suspense thriller First Kill directed by Shriram Raghavan .
#Text=Sandeep ’s career in films began with his first role in the movie Mammo ( 1994 ) directed by the legendary Shyam Benegal , set in the backdrop of India-Pakistan partition ( 1947 ) .
#Text=He was seen playing the role of an immigration officer ( Apte ) who tries to help the immigrant protagonist Mammo .

#Text=He played the role of a gangster , Shankar , who chases the hero throughout the plot wearing a new pair of shoes that bite and eventually hurt him in Is Raat Ki Subaah Nahin ( 1996 ) directed by Sudhir Mishra .
#Text=His role added to the black humor of the film .
#Text=He played a Naxalite who later becomes an activist , in spite of his colleagues being caught and killed in Hazar Chaurasi Ki Maa ( 1998 ) , directed by Govind Nihalani .
#Text=Shwaas ( 2004 ) , directed by Sandip Sawant , put Sandeep ’s performance in the spotlight .

#Text=He played the role of an oncologist who attempts to convince the grandfather of a child suffering from eye cancer to agree to a life-saving surgery although he is faced with the reality of child becoming permanently blind .
#Text=Sandeep 's biggest compliment of his career was earned when , after watching the film , the legendary actor Shabana Azmi asked him if he had studied medicine .
#Text=Shwass won Sandeep numerous awards : the State Award being one of them .
#Text=The film won the National Award as well and was India 's official entry to the Oscars .
#Text=In a 2005 film , Hazaaron Khwaishein Aisi , directed by Sudhir Mishra , Sandeep played a Naxal leader , Probir , involved in spreading the Naxalite movement from Bengal to India .

#Text=2005 saw another success in Sandeep 's career when he played a common man from downtown ( Dombivali ) , on the edge of busy , frustrating , unimproved and deteriorating daily lifestyle who eventually starts straightening things around him in the critically acclaimed Dombivali Fast , directed by Nishikant Kamath .
#Text=In 2005 Sandeep also played the role of Sane Guruji , a biopic teacher , poet , freedom fighter , also known as Gandhiji of Maharashtra in Sane Guruji .
#Text=Sandeep ’s career includes other series of films such as Adhantari ( 2005 ) , Maay Baap ( 2006 ) , Rajkaran ( 2007 ) .
#Text=Traffic Signal ( 2006 ) is a national award-winning film , directed by Madhur Bhandarkar , where Sandeep played an NGO volunteer who is seen helping street children .

#Text=In the Marathi film Made in China ( 2009 ) , he took the role of a young farmer who is literate and updated on technology and who challenges his uncle , a politician who intends to bring in a special economic zone ( SEZ ) .
#Text=2009 also saw him perform the double role of a young businessman creating identity crisis for his wife , family and friends .

#Text=In 2009 Sandeep won the best actor award in the International Nigerian Film Festival for Ek Daav Sansaracha where he plays the role of a husband with a complex due to a failed marriage , blamed impotency and his struggle to make a second marriage work .
#Text=In 2010 other Marathi films that Sandeep acted in include Khel Saat Baaracha and Pratisaad - The Response .
#Text=Other films in the pipeline scheduled for release in 2011 included Nirvana 13 and Paranoia ( under production ) .
#Text=Sandeep Kulkarni also influenced people by showing his tremendous work in the Marathi movie Duniyadari .
#Text=In 2014 , he was a producer of Dombivili Return , a sequel to the 2005 film Dombivali Fast . [ 3 ]
#Text=Personal life
#Text=Sandeep married Kanchan Naik in 1999 .
#Text=They have a son .
#Text=Sandeep has a brother named Sachin .
